intro: Fimbristylis cymosa var. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed flat sedge, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia and Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats such as marshes and swamps. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
